frameDefinitions: A Protagonist is described as being exposed to a potentially dangerous situation that may end in a Bad_outcome for him- or herself.
An Emitter emits a Beam of light from a Source, along a Path, and/or towards a Goal.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
This frame covers the basic uses of direction words like the adverbs east, up, and forward.
An Agent causes an Impactor to make sudden, forcible contact with an Impactee, or manipulates two (or more)
A Landmark (in combination with the image schema evoked by particular targets) serves to pick out the final location of a Trajector in a construed or actual motion event.
frameExamples: Avoid allowing light to <t>shine</t> into neighbors' gardens.
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
He <t>slammed</t> his fist down on the table and bellowed something unintelligible.
Flights <t>into</t> Denver are not permitted at this time.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who is at risk of some <fen>Bad_outcome</fen>
A situation that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> would like to avoid.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protagonist</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The <fen>Action</fen> that creates the risk.
The time when the risk pertains.
The place where there is risk.
This role identifies the entity at the <fen>Source</fen> from which the <fen>Beam</fen> originates.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> occupies initially before its change of location.
The light that travels from a <fen>Source</fen> along a <fen>Path</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Path</fen> refers to where the <fen>Beam</fen> travels over or to a landmark the <fen>Beam</fen> travels by.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> ends up in.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The one-dimensional set of locations.
The <fen>Impactee</fen> is the entity which is hit by the <fen>Impactor</fen>.
The <fen>Impactor</fen> is the entity that hits the <fen>Impactee</fen> because of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s efforts.
The <fen>Impactors</fen> are the multiple entities that collide.
The <fen>Agent</fen>  causes an impact.

The <fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, 
typically non-human, force that causes an <fen>Impactor</fen> to make sudden, 
forcible contact with an Impactee.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the impact occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The relatively locatable entity which serves as a basis for determining the location of the <fen>Trajector</fen> using the <fen>Profiled_region</fen>.
The location (located with respect to the <fen>Landmark</fen>) which is profiled by the particular image schema pertaining to the locative relation.
The entity which is construed to be in motion, whose location at the end of the construed motion event is in question.
The time at which the <fen>Trajector</fen> is located in the <fen>Profiled_region</fen>.
listRoleExamples: There was no risk <fex>of his returning</fex>.
The risk <fex>to his reputation</fex> was significant.
<fex>Implementing this program</fex> runs the risk of offending our core constituents.
<fex>Even after the end of Apartheit</fex> we still run the risk of letting racism continue forever.
There is always some danger to rich men <fex>in a bar like this</fex>.
<fex>Sunlight</fex> gleamed from the water of the bay.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
What I want to know is who smacked <fex>my head</fex> with a 10-ton truck?
Those hoodlums strike my car <fex>with water balloons</fex> every day!
Mr. Addams likes to collide <fex>toy trains</fex> at high speed.
<fex>One juggler</fex> was hitting the ceiling with every other ball.
A postman rammed his Fiat Panda into a getaway car <fex>after spotting the burglars </fex> .
Father Shanahan , of Rushey Mead , Leicester , rammed his Datsun into another car <fex>on the way to the city 's Gilroes cemetery</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: a tenth of a thousandth of a second
